events.name: Young Inventors Workshop
events.description:
Sign up by 26th August to get early bird discounts!
Through this course, students will be taught how they can design their very own electronic projects from scratch by first learning the fundamentals of electronics and prototyping, as well as familiarizing themselves with the components commonly used in toys and mobile devices such as Breadboards, Resistors, LEDs, Transistors, Buzzers and IC Chips. This is definitely the course for all who wish to embark on the journey towards becoming a great inventor!
Date & Time: 6, 7, 8 Sep 2017; 10am – 1pm (Students should be able to attend for all 3 days)Duration: 3 sessions of 3 hours eachEarly Bird Fee (By 26 Aug): SGD $220.00Standard Fee (After 26 Aug): SGD $270.00 Contact Person: Gabriel @ 9653 0164
Register at https://www.surveymonkey.com/r/TW5RDFN 

Workshop Outline
Please refer below for the outline of activities conducted over the three days:

About the trainer: Gabriel Perumal
Gabriel has a strong passon for electronics and he hopes to extend this passion to both young children and parents who accompany them. He has been actively conducting DIY electronics workshops for kids and families, all for the mission of unleashing children's potential in technology. Through Electronics Made Easy, he wants to improve knowledge of tech in Singapore and hopefully, see a future where electronics education is made compulsory for schools.
Interested to see Gabriel in action? Check out his preview video on a DIY game console here: https://youtu.be/ai0an0M0deA
About the organiser: Electronics Made Easy
Electronics Made Easy consist of a team of young engineers keen on educating the future generation through fun and engaging activities. They believe that a building block style of learning, rather than repetitive work, is key to creating the best engineers for Singapore.They have conducted various workshops for kids.
events.location: Informatics City Campus, 100 Victoria Street  #13-01/02 National Library Building, Singapore 188064, Singapore 188064

events.name: Workshop by SUSS on Blockchain, Cryptocurrency, Smart Contracts
events.description: Hi Likers, On Wed 6Sep, there is a workshop on Crytocurrency, Ethereum, Smart Contracts, as well as Blockchain, which is organised by Singapore University of Social Sciences. Please register at the link below and go to the venue directly before 6.30pm on 6 Sep Wednesday. Registration: https://goo.gl/wRzxvq­ RSK Labs (aka Rootstock) has created the first Smart Contracts platform secured by the Bitcoin Network fully compatible with Ethereum. Recently RSK Labs has also designed Lumino, an offchainpayment network similar to the Lightning Network. Together with a new onchain compression protocol can provide a game-changing scaling solution that can process up to[masked] transactions per second solving bitcoin's transaction capacity problem. These technologies provide a major boost in efficiency of retail and P2P transactions, especially those involving micropayments. The new breakthrough arrived just a few weeks after the first implementation of scaling solution Segregated Witness (SegWit) was deployed as a soft fork in the Litecoin network, and later on August 24, has also been activated on the Bitcoin network. Concurrently, there are plans to implement SegWit2x which would eventually introduce a hard fork in the Bitcoin blockchain on late November. Ethereum has also recently introduced Plasma, a scaling infrastructure for the Ethereum blockchain, and there is also PeaceRelay, to be maintained and developed by Kyber Network, that enables two-way relay between Ethereum and Ethereum Classic, or basically any Ethereum-based blockchain. Event Details Date: 6 September 2017 (Wednesday) Time: 6:00pm - 9:00pm (Registration starts at 6:00pm) Venue: Singapore University of Social Sciences Block B, Level 2, LT B.2.17 461 Clementi Road, Singapore 599491. Programme Details 6:00pm – 6:30pm Registration 6:30pm – 6:35pm Welcome speech by Mr. Anson Zeall Co-Founder | Chairman, ACCESS 6:35pm – 6:45pm Welcome speech by Mr. Shaun Djie Co-Founder, DigixGlobal 6:45pm – 7:05pm Keynote speech by Mr. Diego Gutierrez Zaldi­var CEO & Co-Founder, RSK Labs Bitcoin, Blockchain and the Internet of Value 7:05pm – 7:15pm Prep. Talk by Dr. Lo Swee Won Lecturer, School of Business, SUSS "Blockchain Language Made Simple" 7:15pm – 8:45pm Panel Discussion "Forks, Side Chains and Smart Contracts" chaired by Prof. David LEE Kuo Chuen Panel Members Mr. Diego Gutierrez Zaldivar CEO & Co-Founder, RSK Labs Mr. Loi Luu Co-Founder, Kyber Network Mr. Roy Lai CEO/Co-Founder, Infocorp Technologies Mr. Shaun Djie Co-Founder, Digix Global Dr. Wang Xinxi Director and Founding Member, Litecoin Foundation 8:45pm – 8:50pm Closing speech by Mr. Chia Hock Lai President, Singapore FinTech Association Panel Members Mr. Diego Gutierrez Zaldivar CEO & Co-Founder, RSK Labs Diego Gutierrez was one of the pioneers of web developmen t in Argentina and Latin America back in 1995 and has had a leading role in fostering Bitcoin technology in Latin America since 2012. He is a co-founder of RSK, the first open source smart contract platform and payment network powered by Bitcoin, and Koibanx, both companies aimed to turn the transformative potential of Bitcoin into a reality and at the service of social transformation. Diego is also one of the founders of the Argentinean Bitcoin Community which has over 2,000 members registered on the meetups and 20,000 members on its online community. His track record also includes being part of the founding teams of Clar­n Digital (main Argentina’s newspaper website), Patagon.c (financial community sold to Banco Santander for 750M), Internet Argentina (first Argentinean ISP to provide ADSL), Edunexo (provider of a SaaS platform to administer public and private educational institutions in Latin America and Spain). As well, he has held positions as R&D Manager for ElSitio.com leading a team of 25 developers and CTO at Trusted Translations, Inc. Mr. Loi Luu Co-Founder, Kyber Network Loi Luu is a cofounder of KyberNetwork and a researcher working on cryptocurrencies, smart contract security and distributed consensus algorithms. He is also a regular invited speaker at Bitcoin and Ethereum workshops such as DevCon2, EDCON. Loi believes in the force of the Ethereum and Blockchain technology. Much of his work revolves around this community. He developed Oyente, the first open-source security analyzer for Ethereum smart contracts. Loi also cofounded SmartPool, another open source project which embraces decentralization of mining pools in existing cryptocurrency. He continues to champion decentralisation and trustless properties of the Blockchain with KyberNetwork, taking inspiration and developing value for the community. Mr. Roy Lai CEO/Co-Founder, Infocorp Technologies Roy is a seasoned senior executive, with investment banking, foreign exchange trading and inter-bank payment subject matter expertise. A natural innovator in financial technologies, he is instrumental in the delivery of FAST, an ambitious real-time payment network across 14 Singapore banks. He has strong background in creating cryptocurrencies trading systems as well as providing consultations in the use of blockchain and smart contract technologies in solving real-world problems. Mr. Shaun Djie Co-Founder, Digix Global Shaun, an alumni of Singapore Management University, joined the founding team as a co-founder of DigixGlobal and is also the founder and lead organizer for Ethereum Singapore meetup group - the largest of its kind in Asia with almost 2,800 members. Having been exposed to blockchain technology since its early days, he also got involved in writing a paper for the MTI Smart Nation research on blockchain technology back in 2015. DigixGlobal, the first company to ever conduct a crowdsale on the Ethereum blockchain, was also the first company to conduct the first ever live transaction on Ethereum. Dr. Wang Xinxi Director and Founding Member, Litecoin Foundation Dr. Wang Xinxi is the founder of Coinut.com and the Litecoin Foundation. He obtained his Ph.D. degree in computer science from National University of Singapore in 2015 with a focus on machine learning/recommender systems, and before that, he got his bachelor degree from a top 10 university in China. He gained years of experience in automated trading in the forex markets before he dived into the fascinating cryptocurrency world, where he found a perfect match of his background in computer science and financial trading. He founded Coinut.com in 2014, which is now the fastest cryptocurrency exchange in the world. He also founded the Litecoin Foundation nonprofit organisation in this April and has raised enough funds to support full-time developers for Litecoin. Beside those, he also develops Litecoin Core and has accelerated the activation of SegWit on Litecoin
events.location: SUSS LT B.2.17 @ Block B Level 2, 461 Clementi Road, Singapore

events.name: Facilitated study group for CISSP certification exam
events.description: Come and learn collaboratively and prepare better for your upcoming CISSP certification exam. Discuss and resolve any doubts you might have. Meet other candidates who are also preparing for the test. This study group is hosted by industrial veterans with years of IT Security Experience and volunteers. Focus domain of this session is Cryptography. Agenda: 7:00 - 7:30 PM Quick walkthough of CISSP domain Cryptography 7:30 - 8:30 PM Group discussion/sharing: pain points, clarifications, Q&A 8:30 - 9:00 PM Group discussion/sharing: exam preparation, discussion/Q&A on other domains Location: Harbour Front Center Level 10 (take lift from office lobby D), our volunteer will be there between 6:45-7:15 to take you to the meeting room. Price: $0 This is not an exam training course nor a sneak-preview for one. Participation is free. Participants are encouraged to read up the chapter before this session, and come with questions or topics you want to discuss.
events.group_name: Security Decoded Study and Discussion Group

events.name: DataJam!
events.description: We're looking to increase our contributions to the social sector here in Singapore, and will be having a monthly meeting for volunteers who want to do more. These will be working sessions which can include: • DataJams where data is cleaned and prepped for further analysis, • Clinics for social sector organisations to drop in and ask data-related questions, and • Planning sessions for wider community events. Please understand that no food will be provided, so do make preparations to grab a bite before you turn up. Also, it would be great if you bring your own water bottle along with your laptop and power cable too. Agenda 6.45 - 7pm: Registration7 - 7.30pm: Data review and task assignment7.30 - 9.30pm: Data cleaning
events.location: Tableau Singapore, South Beach Tower Level 10, 38 Beach Road

events.name: Singapore Magento User Group Meetup - September 2017
events.description:
Date: Wednesday, 6th Sep 2017 Venue: Microsoft Singapore, One Marina Boulevard Level 22,[masked], Singapore Conference room: 22CF-12Time: 7:00 - 9:00PM  Agenda: 1.  Future of retail is here with the AI - Are you ready? by Anand Ramdeo 2. Use Logistics to power your e-commerce growth by Senthil Kumar  3. Mobile UX in Magento - delighting users to buy by Kali Charan Rajput (KC)  Details: 1.  Future of retail is here with the AI - Are you ready? by Anand Ramdeo About topic: Artificial Intelligence is increasingly becoming mainstream in many industries. From defeating the best go player in the world to discovering drugs, AI is every where. In the retail sector, organizations like Amazon are already harnessing the power of the AI in many interesting ways. Experiments such as Amazon Go and Echo gives a glimpse of how retail stores of future might look like and operate. In this talk, we would explore some interesting ways in which organisations in the retail sector are experimenting with the AI and preparing themselves for the future. Come along to discuss some interesting ideas in this space. 

About Anand: A go-to person for managing innovation, achieving engineering excellence at scale, consulting strategies for growth, and identifying how IT can be the biggest differentiator and transform the business. Anand has founded a software product company in the past, provided consulting to big brands across the Europe, and worked with software powerhouse such as Amazon, IBM Rational, etc. With Master’s degree at Kingston University in London and engineering degree in India, Anand shares knowledge freely and has presented in conferences such as Swiss Testing Days, EuroSTAR, Selenium Conference, Agile Testing Days, CAST, XP Days and so on.LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/in/anandramdeo/ 


2. Use Logistics to power your e-commerce growth by Senthil KumarAbout topic:  Omni channel e-commerce is on the rise as customers look for a seamless buying experience regardless of the channels they use. With the ever-changing e-commerce market, retailers are now more than ever looking to develop a competitive supply chain solution when it comes to fulfilling consumers’ orders in an effective manner. Are you looking to expand your e-commerce cross-border business with DHL eCommerce? Find more about network and trade insights with experts from DHL eCommerce in this session. Learn how you, like other Singaporean manufacturers, resellers and retailers, can ride the e-commerce wave to grow your ecommerce business beyond Singapore’s saturated consumer market. We have Senthil Kumar, Sales Director from DHL eCommerce on board to share the latest trends and insights in the ecommerce market. About Senthil: Senthil Kumar is the Head of Sales for DHL eCommerce Singapore. He has over 15 years of logistics experience, managing operations in warehousing and transportation across the freight, express and postal industries. In his current role, he is responsible for ensuring profitable revenue growth for the company by working with and ensuring the success of e-commerce based customers in both SME and MNC segments. Having spent the early part of his logistics career working in operational and project management capacities, Senthil is able to incorporate practical operational knowledge with customers experience and offer customer-centric logistics solutions for customers.  

3. Mobile UX in Magento - delighting users to buy by Kali Charan Rajput (KC)  About topic: Mobile traffic has increased in recent years and 30 to 50% users are surfing eCommerce websites. Mobile usability study reveals how the touch interface, the small screen, and user’s mobile behavior introduce a whole host of pitfalls to watch out for when designing and running a mobile e-commerce site. The presentation will focus on the design and usability of the full mobile experience of the entire eCommerce/Magento store mobile app. About KC: UI/UX Lead at Ranosys Technologies India. KC has over 8 years of experience in UI/UX and has vast expertise in eCommerce user experience. KC main focus is on Design User Interface (UI) focusing on anticipating what users might need to do and ensuring that the interface has elements that are easy to access and understand. 



Want to speak or share your experience with the community? Send a message or comment below. Connect with us on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/groups/SingaporeMagentoUserGroup/
events.location: Microsoft Singapore, One Marina Boulevard, Level 22, 018989, Singapore
